content:
<CONTEXT>
<CLASS>
   @JsonInclude(Include.NON_NULL)
public record ChatCompletionRequest(@JsonProperty("contents") List<ChatCompletionMessage> contents,
		@JsonProperty("systemInstruction") ChatCompletionMessage systemInstruction,
		@JsonProperty("generationConfig") GenerationConfig generationConfig,
		@Nullable @JsonProperty("tools") List<Tool> tools
) {
	public ChatCompletionRequest(Prompt prompt, GoogleGeminiChatOptions options) {
		this(prompt.getInstructions()
			.stream()
			.filter(instruction -> instruction.getMessageType() != MessageType.SYSTEM)
			.map(ChatCompletionMessage::new)
			.toList(), ChatCompletionMessage.getSystemInstruction(prompt), GenerationConfig.of(options),null);
		Assert.isTrue(prompt.getInstructions()
			.stream()
			.filter(instruction -> instruction.getMessageType() == MessageType.SYSTEM)
			.count() <= 1, "Only one system message is allowed in the prompt.");
	}
}
</CLASS>
</CONTEXT>


i got this error:
```
org.springframework.ai.retry.NonTransientAiException: 400 - {
  "error": {
    "code": 400,
    "message": "Invalid value at 'tools[0].function_declarations[0].parameters' (type.googleapis.com/google.ai.generativelanguage.v1beta.Schema), "{
  "$schema" : "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "type" : "object",
  "properties" : {
    "lat" : {
      "type" : "number",
      "format" : "double",
      "description" : "The city latitude"
    },
    "location" : {
      "type" : "string",
      "description" : "The city and state e.g. San Francisco, CA"
    },
    "lon" : {
      "type" : "number",
      "format" : "double",
      "description" : "The city longitude"
    },
    "unit" : {
      "type" : "string",
      "enum" : [ "C", "F" ],
      "description" : "Temperature unit"
    }
  },
  "required" : [ "lat", "location", "lon", "unit" ],
  "description" : "Weather API request",
  "additionalProperties" : false
}"",
    "status": "INVALID_ARGUMENT",
    "details": [
      {
        "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.rpc.BadRequest",
        "fieldViolations": [
          {
            "field": "tools[0].function_declarations[0].parameters",
            "description": "Invalid value at 'tools[0].function_declarations[0].parameters' (type.googleapis.com/google.ai.generativelanguage.v1beta.Schema), "{
  "$schema" : "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "type" : "object",
  "properties" : {
    "lat" : {
      "type" : "number",
      "format" : "double",
      "description" : "The city latitude"
    },
    "location" : {
      "type" : "string",
      "description" : "The city and state e.g. San Francisco, CA"
    },
    "lon" : {
      "type" : "number",
      "format" : "double",
      "description" : "The city longitude"
    },
    "unit" : {
      "type" : "string",
      "enum" : [ "C", "F" ],
      "description" : "Temperature unit"
    }
  },
  "required" : [ "lat", "location", "lon", "unit" ],
  "description" : "Weather API request",
  "additionalProperties" : false
}""
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}

```

i suspect, #class:ChatCompletionRequest is not quite correct. Fix it

The error indicates that the Gemini API expects the `parameters` field in `function_declarations` (inside `tools`) to be a parsed JSON object (not a stringified JSON schema). Most likely, your code is serializing the schema as a string, but the API expects a structured object.

To fix this, you should ensure that the `parameters` field in your `Tool`/`FunctionDeclaration` model is a `Map<String, Object>` (or similar), not a `String`. This way, Jackson will serialize it as a JSON object, not a string.

I'll review the `ChatCompletionRequest` and related classes to ensure the `tools` field and its nested `parameters` are correctly typed and serialized. First, I need to see how `Tool` and `FunctionDeclaration` are defined and used.

I'll search for their definitions and usages.

tool_responses.responseData: {"result":"success","content":[{line=91, column=36, content="\tpublic static Map<String, Object> jsonToMap(String json) {"}, {line=92, column=10, content="\t\treturn jsonToMap(json, OBJECT_MAPPER);"}, {line=102, column=36, content="\tpublic static Map<String, Object> jsonToMap(String json, ObjectMapper objectMapper) {"}]}

tool_responses.name: read_file

content:
The root cause is that `GoogleGeminiChatModel` passes `td.inputSchema()` (a JSON string) directly as the `parameters` field of `FunctionDeclaration`, but Gemini expects a parsed JSON object, not a string.

**To fix this:**  
In `GoogleGeminiChatModel`, change:
```java
.map(td -> new GoogleGeminiApi.FunctionDeclaration(td.name(), td.description(), td.inputSchema()))
```
to:
```java
.map(td -> new GoogleGeminiApi.FunctionDeclaration(td.name(), td.description(), ModelOptionsUtils.jsonToMap(td.inputSchema())))
```
This will ensure the `parameters` field is a structured object, not a string, matching Gemini's API expectations.

I'll make this change in `GoogleGeminiChatModel`.

content:
I fixed the bug by ensuring the tool schema is parsed into a Map before being sent to Gemini, so the `parameters` field is now a JSON object as required by the API.

Your Maven build failed due to unresolved `${revision}` properties in some unrelated modules, but this won't affect the fix for Gemini tool calling if you only build/test the relevant module. If you need help resolving the Maven version issues, let me know!

This error means the Gemini API does not accept the `$schema` and `additionalProperties` fields in the tool parameter schema. These are part of the standard JSON Schema, but Gemini expects a simplified subsetspecifically, it does **not** want `$schema` or `additionalProperties` at the top level of the parameters object.

**How to fix:**  
You need to filter out `$schema` and `additionalProperties` from the schema before sending it to Gemini.  
The best place to do this is right before you call `new GoogleGeminiApi.FunctionDeclaration(...)` in `GoogleGeminiChatModel`.

**What to do:**
- Write a small utility method that recursively removes these keys from a `Map<String, Object>`.
- Apply this method to the parsed schema before passing it to the FunctionDeclaration.

Would you like me to implement this utility and update the code for you?
